data.title: Harrisburg, OR
data.meta_description: In 2022, Harrisburg, OR had a population of 3.66k people with a median age of 33.5 and a median household income of $51,708. Between 2021 and 2022 the population of Harrisburg, OR grew from 3,645 to 3,663, a 0.494% increase and its median household income grew from $44,044 to $51,708, a 17.4% increase.
data.text:
As of 2022, 100% of Harrisburg, OR residents were US citizens, which is higher than the national average of 93.5%. In 2021, the percentage of US citizens in Harrisburg, OR was 100%, meaning that the rate of citizenship has been maintaining.

In 2022, there were 14.1 times more White (Non-Hispanic) residents (3.15k people) in Harrisburg, OR than any other race or ethnicity. There were 223 Two+ (Non-Hispanic) and 182 Two+ (Hispanic) residents, the second and third most common ethnic groups.

As of 2022, 0.874% of Harrisburg, OR residents (32 people) were born outside of the United States, which is lower than the national average of 13.6%. In 2021, the percentage of foreign-born citizens in Harrisburg, OR was 0.768%, meaning that the rate has been increasing.

The most common job groups, by number of people living in Harrisburg, OR, are Office & Administrative Support Occupations (224 people), Material Moving Occupations (190 people), and Sales & Related Occupations (144 people). This chart illustrates the share breakdown of the primary jobs held by residents of Harrisburg, OR.

The most common employment sectors for those who live in Harrisburg, OR, are Manufacturing (298 people), Retail Trade (190 people), and Health Care & Social Assistance (176 people). This chart shows the share breakdown of the primary industries for residents of Harrisburg, OR, though some of these residents may live in Harrisburg, OR and work somewhere else. Census data is tagged to a residential address, not a work address.

Members of the House of Representives are elected to 2-year terms, and the following chart shows the how the members for Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia, Washington, West Virginia, Wisconsin, and Wyoming have changed over time starting in 2008.

In 2022, 0.928% of men over 25 years of age had not completed any academic degree (no schooling), while 0.891% of women were in the same situation.

This visualization illustrates the percentage distribution of the population according to the highest educational level reached. You can filter the data by race by using the selector above.

The following chart display owner-occupied housing units distributed between a series of property tax buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. In Harrisburg, OR the largest share of households pay taxes in the $3k+ range.

In 2022, 75.9% of the housing units in Harrisburg, OR were occupied by their owner. This percentage declined from the previous year's rate of 76.9%.

The following chart displays the households in Harrisburg, OR distributed between a series of income buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. The largest share of households have an income in the $75k - $100k range.

In N/A, the income inequality in N/A was N/A according to the GINI calculation of the wage distribution. Income inequality had a N/A N/A from N/A to N/A, which means that wage distribution grew somewhat N/A even. The GINI for N/A was N/A than the national average of 0.478. In other words, wages are distributed N/A evenly in N/A in comparison to the national average.

In 2022, 67.6% of workers in Harrisburg, OR drove alone to work, followed by those who carpooled to work (19.7%) and those who worked at home (10.2%).

The following chart shows the number of households using each mode of transportation over time, using a logarithmic scale on the y-axis to help better show variations in the smaller means of commuting.

Using averages, employees in Harrisburg, OR have a shorter commute time (20.6 minutes) than the normal US worker (26.7 minutes). Additionally, 0% of the workforce in Harrisburg, OR have "super commutes" in excess of 90 minutes.

The following chart displays the households in Harrisburg, OR distributed between a series of car ownership buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. The largest share of households in Harrisburg, OR have 2 cars.

13.3% of the population for whom poverty status is determined in Harrisburg, OR (488 out of 3.66k people) live below the poverty line, a number that is higher than the national average of 12.5%. The largest demographic living in poverty are Males < 5, followed by Females 35 - 44 and then Females 55 - 64.

The most common racial or ethnic group living below the poverty line in Harrisburg, OR is White, followed by Two Or More and Hispanic.

The Census Bureau uses a set of money income thresholds that vary by family size and composition to determine who classifies as impoverished. If a family's total income is less than the family's threshold than that family and every individual in it is considered to be living in poverty.

In 2017, California had the highest estimated number of chronically homeless individuals in the nation, at 35,798. New York has the second highest (5,087), followed by Florida (4,915).

In 2022, insured persons according to age ranges were distributed in 31.2% under 18 years, 22.8% between 18 and 34 years, 38.6% between 35 and 64 years, and 7.37% over 64 years.

Between 2021 and 2022, the percent of uninsured citizens in Harrisburg, OR declined by 62.1% from 4.97% to 1.88%.

The following chart shows how the percent of uninsured individuals in Harrisburg, OR changed over time compared with the percent of individuals enrolled in various types of health insurance.
